basics.name: Lars Quaedvlieg
basics.label: Research Scientist Intern
basics.summary: Research Scientist Intern at Meta with expertise in Foundation Models, Reinforcement Learning, and AI for Science

work.name: Caglar Gulcehre Lab for AI Research @ EPFL
work.summary: Working on foundation models for decision-making problems, specifically on efficient RL for long-horizon problems with algorithm distillation

work.name: InstaDeep
work.summary: Pre-training Transformer models on a large offline reinforcement learning dataset (1+ billion transitions) of the classic Atari benchmark

work.name: Laboratory for Information and Inference Systems @ EPFL
work.summary: Co-authored a paper about self-supervised learning for combinatorial optimization problems and worked on hospital staff scheduling using deep reinforcement learning and graph neural networks

work.name: Aucos AG
work.summary: Developed solutions for production line optimization and multi-camera tracking

courses: Large-Scale Data Science For Real-World Data
Mathematics of Data: from Theory to Computation

awards.title: Winner - Mini-Hackathon on Multimodal Apps and Training LLMs
awards.summary: Won the Organizer's prize for Tralala, a tool that enables users to generate and refine 3D models dynamically using natural inputs like text prompts, spoken descriptions, or reference images

awards.title: Winner - LauzHack 2025
awards.summary: Second place in LauzHack 2025. Developed an on-device Flask-based web application for creating, managing, and visualizing notes effectively and securely using RAG and LLM models

awards.title: Winner - HackUPC 2024
awards.summary: Won [MLH] Best Use of Taipy and Intersystems Challenge - Best use of GenAI using InterSystems IRIS Vector Search for WALL-M, an AI-powered email assistant

awards.title: Research Scholar Assistant
awards.summary: Highly competitive research program at the Caglar Gulcerhe's Lab for AI Research (CLAIRE)

awards.title: Master's Excellence Fellowship, EPFL
awards.summary: Two-year fellowship valued at 40,000 CHF, awarded to ~3% of EPFL master students based on outstanding academic records

awards.title: CS-503 Visual Intelligence Best Project Award
awards.summary: Secured first place among 14 teams for project 'Hunting for Insights: Investigating Predator-Prey Dynamics through Simulated Vision and Reinforcement Learning'

awards.title: Best Bachelor's Thesis Award 2023
awards.summary: University-wide award valued at 500 EUR for the best bachelor's thesis research among all other students in the programme

publications.name: Algorithm Discovery With LLMs: Evolutionary Search Meets Reinforcement Learning
publications.summary: Discovering efficient algorithms for solving complex problems has been an outstanding challenge in mathematics and computer science, requiring substantial human expertise over the years. Recent advancements in evolutionary search with large language models (LLMs) have shown promise in accelerating the discovery of algorithms across various domains, particularly in mathematics and optimization.

publications.name: Optimizing Job Allocation using Reinforcement Learning with Graph Neural Networks
publications.summary: Efficient job allocation in complex scheduling problems poses significant challenges in real-world applications. In this report, we propose a novel approach that leverages the power of Reinforcement Learning (RL) and Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) to tackle the Job Allocation Problem (JAP).

publications.name: PASTA: Pretrained Action-State Transformer Agents
publications.summary: Self-supervised learning has brought about a revolutionary paradigm shift in various computing domains, including NLP, vision, and biology. Recent approaches involve pre-training transformer models on vast amounts of unlabeled data, serving as a starting point for efficiently solving downstream tasks.

publications.name: Maximum Independent Set: Self-Training through Dynamic Programming
publications.publisher: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS)
publications.summary: This work presents a novel graph neural network (GNN) framework for solving the maximum independent set (MIS) inspired by dynamic programming (DP).

publications.name: Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning with Graph Neural Networks for Online Multi-Hoist Scheduling
publications.summary: This thesis explores an approach to solving the online multi-hoist scheduling problem by combining graph neural networks and multi-agent reinforcement learning.

volunteer.summary: Bridging the gap between theory and practice by giving the students a platform to develop their projects and participate in workshops, seminars, hackathons, and more

One of two student representatives of 800, responsible for raising students' issues, ensuring program quality by renewing study material, extending the curriculum by adding new courses, and looking into internal regulations of the bachelor program
Treasurer, secretary, and community manager at a department-wide study association comprised of 800 members
Tutoring and hosting group exam-preparation sessions for undergraduate students in computer science- and mathematics-related topics
